settings.helpText: Must follow format: United Kingdom, EMEA
The url must always follow this format: /trainings/{session-name}
A quick description of the training that took place
Use this as the link to the location of the piece of info, if it's a PDF you can ignore this
The slug field should always be as follows: /sales/case-study/{account-name}
Who is the TAM on this account?
Use case examples: Ecommerce, websites, mobile apps, Multi-channel brand experiences, Localisation
Examples: Media & Entertainment, Health Care, Food Production, Consumer Goods & Retail, Automotive, etc..
Use this field to write a short blurb around some of the challenges your account was/has been facing: Generally moving slow, not as agile, lack of awareness on product etc.
Write about the things you have worked on, separate this into a couple of obvious headings like: Objectives, Strategic Planning, Outcome
The slug must follow this format: /knowledge/{category}/{title-of-article}, for ex: /knowledge/javascript-tips-tricks/provision-an-internal-org
Please type the language in lowercase

content.value: Technical Account Manager Hub
TAM Hub comprises all information related to TAMs.
Here you will be able to find all kinds of information from Technical Implementation, to specific customer use cases and case studies, to materials that enable Sales to sell TAM as a service.
Please note that this information is strictly internal and you should exercise caution when sharing material externally.

description.en-US: Take a moment to review our TAM trainings which cover Contentful topics in-depth
Review enablement materials for Sales and obtain more information around the TAM offering
Explore TAM information to help you get started with customers
Take a look at the team and familiarise yourself with points of contact
Reach out to us via Slack

content.value: Training

The home of TAM training, here is the perfect location to find recordings that go over sessions we have had with the team. They are unofficial guides about a technical aspect of Contentful and the ecosystem that surrounds Contentful, that being the front-end world of development.
You can always view more training
here
Sales

The comprehensive repository of documentation designed to support the sales teams is available here. This repository includes RFP documents, presentation decks, and other pertinent materials related to TAM.
What is a TAM?

A Technical Account Manager is an expert in Contentful and responsible for ensuring that you as an organisation succeed using Contentful. It entails helping you technically achieve your goals using Contentful and ensuring you are adopting the product to the maximum potential it has.

They act as your immediate touch-point for all technical queries for the duration of your contract, which means this individual gradually becomes an extension of your team but is based within Contentful.

Your Technical Account Manager will have regular contact with you in syncs that occur in time slots that are good for both parties and actively work with you to overcome any technical obstacles that may arise. Since your Technical Account Manager is with you for the length of your contract they will understand your key objectives and actively help you prioritise things related to Contentful.
Dedicated vs Shared

TAMs come in 2 flavours: a completely dedicated option that works with you and only you, and a shared option that works with you for 10 hours a week when you need that expertise on something related to Contentful.
What are some examples of things we might work on together?
Product issues

This is inevitable, not only will you get the white glove service through a concierge-based service where your TAM is available to you at a moment's notice, but they will actively own your issues with you and for you should the issue reside on Contentful‚Äôs end
Proactive resolutions on any issues with the product
Governance planning

Creating a mapping of roles and permissions within an organisation is something that becomes more and more complex the larger your organisation is and the more teams that are involved in a project, thankfully a TAM is able to guide you on best practices and advise you accordingly, while also thinking about you as a company and what you are trying to achieve.
Architecture support

Consuming Contentful is the main part of a headless CMS, understanding how this works and using best practices is another example of how a TAM can benefit your organisation as they work with you to make choices such as SDK or raw endpoints
Content modeling support

Questions on your content model are inevitable and where do you turn when you are unsure of a question related to it? Or how a particular field works with specific validations? TAMs have expertise in assisting customers in all areas of the product and will no doubt provide benefit to your teams
Workflows assistance

Creating workflows for your end users within Contentful is another area where TAMs are incredibly useful in not only helping you create workflows but also ensuring that they are dynamic and able to grow as your teams/business grow
It doesn't stop there‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

We are in for the long haul, whether it's: Q&A sessions, feature requests/prioritization, dedicated assistance during events such as go-live, EAP features, RCAs, health checks, support ticket troubleshooting and resolution, and more‚Ä¶ the list goes on! In fact, if you take a TAM you‚Äôll help us add to the list!

previewSnippet.en-US: In this session we covered a few topics from a high level: content modelling, next.js, react, vercel, and space architecture

content.value: Tech Talk Session Recap: Content Modelling and Deployment with Contentful, Next.js, and Vercel

In our recent tech talk session, we explored content modelling for a blog and how to effectively use this model in Contentful.

We began by discussing the fundamentals of content modelling, focusing on structuring content types like Blog Posts, Authors, and other necessary reusable blocks of content. Key topics included defining fields such as Title, Slug, Body, Author, Published Date, and establishing relationships between content types to facilitate richer interactions using references.

Next, we moved to practical implementation within Contentful, covering how to set up content types, enter and manage content efficiently, and maintain a clean, organized content repository using best practices.

With the content model in place, we focused on consuming this content in a Next.js application. We covered setting up the Contentful client in a Next.js project, making API requests using REST and our JS SDK, rendering the fetched content in Next.js components, including handling dynamic routing for blog posts and the differences between the App Router and Pages Router.

We then discussed the deployment process to Vercel, including connecting your Next.js project to Vercel and automating deployment on every repository push.

Our last point in the session was understanding how Vercel's CDN hosted our data and how it interacted with our CDN to provide our content. This almost covered the whole frontend ecosystem from a high-level overview.

Thanks to Lisa, Doug, John, and Shanon for listening to me ramble for over an hour!

previewSnippet.en-US: In this session, Akila walks us through the Contentful CLI and it's use cases

content.value: Some example text that goes over the session

challenges.en-US: Philips have been using Contentful for almost 3 years before introducing a TAM, they are in the process of moving off of AEM and have been hitting roadblocks with adopting Contentful and not moving as quickly as they would like to.

content.value: Objectives

From the very get-go with Philips there were key objects and milestones set as they have targets to meet for this calendar year (2024) in regards to English native websites. Their plan is to move around
1.4 million
pages off Adobe and into Contentful so we've been busy building an entire plan around how that is going to work from the ground up.
Here are some of the things we worked on:
Global to Local Space Architecture

This entailed designing a space architecture and a reusable content model that expanded from one space to another, we built content models around the things they are primarily focussed on: landing pages, articles, whitepapers, and information cards.

We utilised the CMA to push content between spaces using an AWS Lambda function that essentially waits for a piece of content to be published, on publish it triggers a clone of that entry and spits out a localised version for all applicable locales that were selected using a custom built locale-picker app built using our App SDK.
Governance

With Philips being a healthcare company governance is one of the most important feature for them. We came up with a solution that works for them using the customizability of our custom roles and permissions. Philips had a solution that gave them more than 3000 roles which just isn't technically possible. thanks to using a TAM we were able to get that done to just 83 roles.
Here is the blueprint:
Architected Workflows

Philips has been very welcoming to adopting as much of Contentful as possible and another example of that is using the Workflows app. Thanks to the Workflows app we were able to build multiple workflows that worked generically for multiple regions and specific regions where the process may be different for Philips as each region has different requirements.
Here is an example of the North American workflow we had to Engineer to work with customised notifications to alert only the necessary people and teams.
Optimised GraphQL Usage

Philips are using our GraphQL endpoint to target the data they require which is the beauty of using GraphQL and a major benefit over REST APIs. An issue they had was that their queries were always incredibly large and complex primarily due to a nested content model, working together we were able to simplify this and also introduce the usage of another AWS service, AWS AppSync.
Custom App Development and Support

A lot of what Philips is doing is not out-of-the-box behaviour, most of it is in fact custom and they have hit a lot of blockers along the road. Using a TAM has enabled them to get over these roadblocks as swiftly as possible. Here is a comprehensive list of the custom apps we've worked on together to enable Philips:
Custom Rich Text Editor using
Slate
Custom date picker to enable publication date and review dates
Custom tagging application
Custom integration with Pool Party embedded in the fields of their content
Custom Locale selector app
Custom label tagging app
Strategic Planning
Philips and their TAM Shane Chaffe have been working closely together using daily syncs to constantly remain in touch and keep Philips on track. We have used
Miro
to comprehensively plan actions and map out blueprints and wireframes of approaches we can take.

Our engagement takes place over Microsoft Teams in an on-call manner meaning they're able to get help relatively fast compared to traditional methods. Using a TAM in comparison to PS means they have support throughout the entire development cycle of their projects where we are able to consistently enable them time and time again.
Outcome

So far the projects have all been delivered on time or early enabling Philips to onboard internal stakeholders more swiftly than they imagined. 

In contrast to not having a TAM, the route would be to open a support ticket which on average has a 40.9-hour average potential resolution time while on average Philips issues/solutions/planning have had outcomes in an
average of the same day usually within 4 hours using a TAM

.

TAM acknowledgement to a query is likely
instantaneous

, whereas a non-urgent question via support has an 8hrs (business hours) first response SLA and a Severity 3 is 4hrs.

Philips successfully renewed the TAM subscription thanks to a flourishing relationship where they feel valued as a customer and partner on their journey to transform their experiences.

Here is what one of their internal team members had to say:

Feedback from Kelly Gilgen (Business Analyst/Web Dev): ‚ÄúWithout a TAM I don‚Äôt believe we would have been able to move as fast as we have done with you pulling in the right resources and sharing the correct knowledge/best practices‚Äù

challenges.en-US: The State undertook a huge project...
Restoration Hardware are undertaking their transition to Contentful and going through a complete overhaul of their content strategy

content.value: Objectives
Currently, Restoration Hardware is overhauling its current content models and we're working together to create designs of effective content models as well as technical POCs.
Strategic Planning

Our planning right now primarily consisted around technical aspects of the products in a daily meeting that we have where we outline RH's use cases for Contentful and plan accordingly. A primary focus has been content modelling so far.
Content Modelling
On the topic of content modelling, we are currently working on how to handle data requests from Contentful, Fusion and DOAT.
Delivery Functions

Although this is something we explored, we have decided that this is something were not an option currently because of the limitations of the current version but Restoration Hardware's wish for product adoption is strong.
Outcomes
Currently, Restoration Hardware have paused projects which makes it harder to work on things due to internal constraints, this will be updated in due course.

challenges.en-US: Taco Bell's primary challenges were making improvements to their content model, refreshing their mobile app and improving their in-store kiosk experience

content.value: Objectives
Taco Bell has a few projects and initiatives in flight at the moment.  These include improvements to their existing content model, mobile app refresh, and simplifying the in-store kiosks experience.
Strategic Planning
Success Plan: eCommerce, Mobile App, and Website Team
Content model
: The Taco Bell team has been working with Contentful to make several improvements within their environment, including: structure (topics vs. assemblies), microcopy patterns, and naming consistency.
Content

: Taco Bell will be working with Contentful's Professional Services (PS) team to identify duplicate, stale, underused, and unused content types within their content model.  Once these content types are identified, the Taco Bell team will confirm and begin to remove them from the environment.  In addition, the team is looking for ways to simplify onboarding for editors, as well as reduce friction for those teams that create content.  For example, in the current content creation process, it can take up to 12 weeks to get updates to go live due to dev team involvement.
Mobile App
: The current iteration of the Taco Bell mobile app was architected over 10 years ago, and so the mobile app team is looking to rebuild the app from the ground up using more modular components.
Lastly, the team is also looking to improve personalization and governance (Q3-Q4 timeframe).
Kiosk Team

The Taco Bell Kiosk team is currently operating in its own space.  These spaces are shared and billed up to the overall Yum Brands team.  To help fund the TAM service, the Kiosk team agreed to migrate their content to the Taco Bell 'shared space,' and retire the existing kiosk team space.  The target for this work is sometime in Q2.
The team would also like assistance in brainstorming new ideas and recommendations around governance.
Outcomes
eCommerce

So far, the Taco Bell team has been engaged in a PS Audit to identify duplicate, stale, underused, and unused content types throughout their environment.  The team is now taking action on these findings and will circle back with TAM and PS for a follow-up call later in June 2024.
Kiosk

: The Kiosk team managed to migrate away from their own space to the shared space in late April 2024, meeting their goal of the Q2 2024 timeframe.  In talking to the Kiosk team, there is interest in Contentful Studio around integration with Stratacache for use with digital menu boards.  As we understand it, they are currently under a long-term contract with Stratacache, but are interested in replacing it if our product is less costly and easier to use.

description.en-US: Take a glimpse at some of the work the TAMs are doing with their customers in depth

previewSnippet.en-US: React decided to take Fanny out on a date and their conversation was all about props, state, and components. Will there be a second date?

content.value: Tic Tac Toe!

The game everyone loved to play as a child is now brought to life with React and the expertise of our instructor Fanny. In this session, Fanny walks us through her React project that was created to go over how we can implement Tic Tac Toe using React. There are a lot of elements to consider with Tic Tac Toe and the key React concepts in the project are components, state, and props.
You can read more about this
here

title.en-US: How to check a request is hitting the cache?

content.value: First, you need to get the request ID
Paste the request ID in Splunk:
Notice the x_cache=HIT which means the request hit the cache. (and ident=fastly)
Notice that the POP in this case is HKG.
If the request is timing out or slow you need to check the CDN provider status (Fastly):
https://status.fastly.com/
And see if it's experiencing any degradation on the POP retrieved in Splunk (HKG in this case).
Example ticket:
https://contentful.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/145332
What are you looking for today? üßê
Common error messages and what to advise next
1. (unverified user- example ticket 61939, example when email is not received #70918)
Notification shown:

Almost there, just one more thing. We‚Äôve noticed that an account already exists for the email address xxx. To continue to log in, we need you to verify your identity by following the instructions in the email we‚Äôve sent you.
Note
: The error happens when user identity changes, and they need to verify that they own the email to solve the problem.
Solution 1
: Advise user to follow the email instructions. Afterward they should be able to login via IdP.
Solution 2
: If user did not get a verification email, the problem might be
old SSO identity
that‚Äôs blocking the user.
Go to user Account tab (example:
https://admin.contentful.com/admin/users/4Cv0CBYpLGnQD328caNFPT#account
Under Identities click on the ID
Click on Trash Identity
Advise the customer to login via IdP
2. (error on customer end -
example ticket 63043
Notification shown:
Error in customer‚Äôs Identity provider
Note:
The most common reason is the customer hasn‚Äôt been granted access to Contentful in their IdP.
Solution:
Advise customers to reach out to their IT admin.
3. (no permission to access the org-
example ticket 62687
Notification shown:

We are sorry, we couldn‚Äôt log you in right now. It looks like you no longer have permission to access this organization. Please get in touch with an organization admin, and ask them to re-invite you to the organization.
Note:
this happens when customer has a valid identity, but org membership is deleted. After the admin invites them again, they will need to set a one-time password to be able to use SSO again.
Solution
: Advise customers to reach out to their Contentful admin to re-invite them to the organization from the web app, then follow the instructions in the invitation email.

**For P&G, some of their users don‚Äôt have access to their inbox, so they can‚Äôt set a one-time password, in this case, we need to trash the user, so they can use another login flow, which doesn‚Äôt require email verification. Please follow
these steps
if it‚Äôs a P&G user without a valid email. Please advise customers to reach out to their Org admin to re-invite the user via IdP after you‚Äôve trashed user account.
4. (single sign on configuration -
example ticket 62707
Notification shown:
We are sorry, we couldn‚Äôt log you in right now. Something is wrong with your single sign-on configuration. Please get in touch with organization admin or contact our support to resolve this issue.
Note:
The most common reason is expired certificates.
This can also be caused by an improper SAML response to Contentful from the customer‚Äôs IdP (
Example Ticket
). We deny access for anything other than a SAML response with a success value. Anything else we receive is indicative of an error on the IdP side.
Solution:
Advise customers to reach out to their IT admin, who needs to check the configuration in the IdP.
5. (doesn't meet requirements -
example ticket 39626
Notification shown:
We‚Äôre sorry we couldn‚Äôt log you in. Some of the information provided by your identity provider doesn‚Äôt meet the requirements for an account. First name is too short (minimum 2 characters)
Note:
Username in their idP is too short, which doesn‚Äôt comply with minimum 2 character rule.
Solution:
Advise customers to reach out to their IT admin.
6. (sign up verification step -
example ticket 64062
Notification shown:
User is asked to fill in the sign up form.
Note:

The sign up page is an expected step in this case (we just ask for a bit more information to verify the name etc.). We have introduced this flow at the end of last year, and it is just an additional verification step so to say.
Solution:
Advise to proceed with the sign up (fill in all details), and then login via IdP.
7. (stuck in ‚Äúverify your account‚Äù loop -
example ticket ZEND-132
User keeps on getting Unlock account emails, once he click on verify account button he is still not able to login via SSO. Reply to user with this verbiage:
Sorry to hear about the difficulties you're having gaining access to your account via SSO.

I took a look at your user account and I'm seeing some strange data patterns associated with your SSO log ins. Not to get too technical, but when you log in via SSO we rely on a key value (called a "Name ID") to be passed in the request from the identity provider you use that tells us who you are. The expectation is that this is a unique, consistent identifier that allows us to recognize you again on subsequent log ins.

What I'm seeing in your case is a different value for the Name ID amongst several log in requests from yesterday. This is highly unusual and suggest a misconfiguration in the identity provider is using.
Is it possible for you to loop someone in this support ticket who is responsible for this IDP configuration on your side? We would need to understand this a bit better to be able to help you.
Let me know if you're able to rope in an organization admin to assist. Alternatively we can pursue previous contacts we've had with your Org in the past to find out who best to work with.
Thanks and sorry for the difficulties!
Misc Q‚Äôs Users have asked in the past:

What integrations do you support SP Initiated or IdP Initiated? We prefer SP Initiated where Service Provider is the system or the organization that hosts the resources that a user needs to access. For externally hosted application, the partner company hosting the application acts as SP. For internally hosted application, our org acts as the SP.
We do support both SP Initiated and IdP Initiated integrations.
Can you confirm that all SSO communication/transaction would happen over HTTPS/SSL channel?
Yes.

A signed SAML AuthN request will be sent to our org‚Äôs IDP to begin SSO. Contentful will provide the X.509 Cert which our org will use to verify the digital signature. After Authentication, outgoing SAML Assertion to Contentful will be digitally signed via an X.509 cert. Our org will provide that cert to Contentful. The outgoing signed SAML assertion would also be encrypted via a cert provided by Contentful. The cert provided by Contentful needs to have enough key size to support AES-256 Encryption and RSA-OAEP key transport algorithm.
This should work on our side.

For simplifying the key management, Contentful can use the same cert to sign the SAML AuthN request as well as perform encryption/decryption. The SAML Subject in the Assertion would contain a transient id i.e. a randomly generated data which is NON-USABLE. All usable data elements would be sent as SAML Attributes in the Assertion.
This should work on our side.
8. (user redirected to login page despite restricted SSO mode -
example ticket 51770
Notification shown:

User is shown usual login form, needs to add username and password even though organization is using restricted SSO mode. This confuses the user as they shouldn‚Äôt be asked for a password during restricted SSO login.
Note:
For the time being this is
expected
behavior.
User has a pre-existing account on Contentful.
User tries to log in via SSO
User sees "Log in to accept this invitation". User
must
log in to this user account to prove that they own the account.
So we used to have a way for them to avoid the "log in" thing by clicking on email link. Now, instead we have them "log in" to their existing account.
There is a problem here ... sometimes a user doesn't have a password because they previously logged in via SSO (or Github/Google SAML).
Solution:

In the meantime the workaround is for the user to just follow the "forgot password" and set a password. This will allow them to set a password to use so that they can "log in" to their existing user account at this step in the SSO screen.
9. Exempt a user from SSO that isn‚Äôt a member yet
Let‚Äôs say you look up a user in Gatekeeper and there is no record yet. You can still exempt them from SSO provided they have been already invited to the org.
Go to the org
Go to Memberships Tab
Find user with pending invite. Ex:
4. Click the organization ID
5. Click ‚ÄúEdit Organization Membership‚Äù
6. Checkbox ‚ÄúExempt from SSO‚Äù
10. Something went wrong
Okta users may sometimes get this. Flag with engineering. Example -
https://contentful.atlassian.net/browse/ZEND-1676
11. Customer is requesting Signature Certificate for SLO (Single Log Out) for SSO

The customer may want to customize how the logout is redirected. For this they can use the x509 cert that is set up on their account within Contentful. We can then update the SLO url by editing the field: idp slo target url within the identity provider in GK. The SLO url will also need to be updated within the customer's SSO.
12. Reload Application error after sign in
After logging in with SSO user receives: ‚ÄúThe session expired Please authenticate again" "Reload application"

The user may be using a VPN. As them to either disable this or create a HAR file. In the HAR file, you may see an error with status code 451. This means that the IP address is coming from a blocked region. In edge cases, Fastly‚Äôs GeoLocater may be off. You can ask the user to visit this site:
https://fastly-inspect.edgecompute.app/
which will show the Client‚Äôs IP. Example Ticket:
https://contentful.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/126911
Pre-requisites
Have
access
to the ‚Äú
Provisioning‚Äù
module of Internal Admin (
https://internal-admin.contentful.com/
) with the role of ‚ÄúRequester‚Äù
Get the
organization ID
to set to
Internal
If you need a
Team
Enterprise
account, you will only be able to create such in Flinkly or Quirely environments. In that case you will also need to have access to the "Provisioning" module of Internal Admin (
Flinkly Link
Quirely Link
) with the role
Requester
and
Approver
(so you can self-approve).
Steps
First check the org only has internal Contentful members.
I. Create a license change request
Connect to
Internal Admin
https://internal-admin.contentful.com/
Select the ‚ÄúOrder provisioning‚Äù module in the right navigation panel (you may have to expand it)
Click the ‚ÄúAdd license change request‚Äù button
Select ‚Äú
Internal organization
‚Äù as the ‚ÄúRequest type‚Äù
Select ‚Äú
Initial
‚Äù as the ‚ÄúOpportunity type‚Äù
Fill organization information
Paste the
organization ID

in the ‚ÄúOrganization Id‚Äù field
‚Üí The system will attempt to retrieve the organization for you. Check that the name under ‚ÄúOrganization name‚Äù on the right is consistent with what you expect. If after entering a correct org ID, it errors out (refresh the page).
Select a
desired provisioning date
in the ‚ÄúProvisioning date‚Äù field. Set the current date for immediate provisioning request, and a date in the future for scheduled provisioning.
Fill in platform and license information
Change the
Tier
to
Internal
The Platform will be automatically set to ‚ÄúInternal platform‚Äù (the only available option)
Add 99 licenses of
Internal space
type, so that you don‚Äôt need to make an extra license change request too soon and have enough licenses for experimentation. Remove 1
Community space
license to keep things tidy and only have Internal spaces.
Click ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù on the top-right corner to send the form
Click " Approve" on the top-right corner to provision the internal license
Check-in gatekeeper that the license has been successfully provisioned
Respond to Contentful employee letting them know their organization has been upgraded to internal.
FAQ

Q: There are other email domains outside of Contentful within this organization, what do I do?
‚Üí
Tell the employee they need to remove any domain names outside of Contentful from the organization before we can upgrade it to Internal.

Q: I don‚Äôt see the ‚ÄúOrder provisioning‚Äù module in Internal Admin
‚Üí Please check with IT that you have access to Internal Admin with the
Requester
Okta role. More information available here:
Internal Admin App

Q: I need Team/Enterprise account for specific testing purposes, what should I do?
‚Üí You will only be able to create such in Flinkly or Quirely environments. In that case you will need to have access to the ‚ÄúProvisioning‚Äù module of Internal Admin (
Flinkly Link
Quirely Link
) with the role ‚ÄúRequester‚Äù and ‚ÄúApprover‚Äù (so you can self-approve).
Create an Internal Org LCR How to Video
Since 22 Nov 2023, we adhere to a new internal process for transferring spaces requested by user.
Step 1 - Customer will fill up the support form with all the information needed. External article here.
Step 2 - Customer Support Engineer Processes the request in Zendesk
Customer Support Engineer checks the information is filled in correctly by reviewing relevant fields on the ticket
user should have added space/org keys (named space IDs in the web app) and confirmation from
both organization owners need to be present
. Otherwise, don't proceed and ask for confirmation first.
Please note:
There must be a space license available to assign the space to after transfer. Please ask customer which space license to be assigned after the transfer.
Open the right-side bar with Apps and find ‚ÄúURL Builder Pro‚Äù app at the bottom - click ‚ÄúTransfer Space between Organizations‚Äù button.
Step 3 - Gatekeeper
The link brings directly to the Gatekeeper ‚ÄúSpace Organization Change‚Äù Page
If multiple spaces were added, an error message will be displayed ‚Äú
Space with key e242iwbax84f, 7jfb7ywzlpvd wasn't found. You can edit the space key and click
Reload
‚Äù -
multiple space transfer is not supported so spaces need to be transferred one after another
Click ‚ÄúRecreate space membership‚Äù if space members should stay in the space. They will be invited to the destination organization.
Click ‚ÄúCreate Space organization change‚Äù
In case of a mistake (for example, multiple space keys in the field), an error message will be displayed
Once the space is successfully transferred you will see a confirmation screen
A transferred space will be archived in the destination organization and a license needs to be assigned
Important:
One last step before closing the ticket is
Inviting the new organization owner back to space-
click on
Bulk invite users
button and fill in the form. Make sure to add only new organization owner(s) from the Destination organization. The new owner will be able to add other users to the transferred space.
Important
Changes are done in GK and Zuora
All active users of the space will be automatically transferred to the destination organization if the 'recreate space membership' box is checked.
If requested otherwise, we can also only invite the owner of the destination organization
Spaces can be transferred with no disruption of service for the customer
Integrations/webhooks/API keys are not affected
Space transfer is possible only with
written confirmation of both organization owners
in the support ticket or can be an internal ticket request from a CSM/AE/AM

If this is an internal request please send the below questions to the AE/CSM/AM for space transfer as they are in direct communication with the customer. If the space transfer is sent by the customer please follow the above bullet points and confirm with the customer that they have no private apps, SSO enable, or team space memberships.
Customer Questions
For ease of transfer; please send these questions to the customer before requesting a space transfer
Do you have SSO enabled on your original organization where the space is currently housed?
If SSO is enabled, do we have the authorization to exempt users within the space to be transferred from SSO to transfer them to the destination organization?
Do you have any Private apps?
If so, please know these do not transfer when the space is transferred and they will need to create a new App definition in the new org and reinstall that app.
Do you have any Team membership within the space to be transferred?
If so, please know these will not transfer with a space transfer and need to be notated and re-created within the new organization after the space transfer.
Please note that we are
not
able to transfer content from one or several spaces directly into another space. Customers will be able to do so on their end with CLI tool.
Example of request: "Customer is working in 3 different spaces, and would like to transfer content from these 3 spaces into one new space in Enterprise organization"
Solution:
Customer will be able to do this on their end with our CLI tool. Please share the following guide on CLI tool:
https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/tutorials/cli/import-and-export/
FAQ
Space ID does not change
Content is not impacted
Current API keys or content Management tokens will continue working
Extensions will keep working as they don't have an App Definition

Private apps will stop working as the App Definition will stay in the original org and the App Installation cannot access the original App Definition anymore once the space was moved. To fix that the customer would need to create a new App Definition in the new org and reinstall that app
WebHooks are stored in GK database and will be moved properly and should keep working
Team Space Memberships will not transfer with a space transfer and need to be notated and re-created within the new organization after the space transfer.
The customer will automatically be invited to the organization but must click the invitation link sent to their email to regain access to the transferred space and destination organization.

previewSnippet.en-US: Karan walks us through the Google Search Engine Console to understand how we can remove indexed assets in search Engines such as Google, Bing, etc

content.value: Removing asset URLs (such as images, documents, or other resources) from search engine results is
sometimes
requested by customers
for the assets they own which were accidentally uploaded

but are still showing up in search results and may have sensitive information which should not be accessible. Below is a step-by-step guide to help you remove asset URLs from Google and Bing search results.
Removing URLs from Google Search Results
Log in to
Google Search Console
If you do not see
assets.ctfassets.net
in Properties, raise a request to get access.
Go to the
Removals
Navigate to the "Removals" section under the "Index" menu.
Click on the
New Request
button.
Enter the URL of the asset you want to remove and click
Next
The request once submitted may take some hours to come into effect
Removing URLs from Bing Search Results
Log in to
Bing Webmaster Tools
First time you have to import the site from Google Search Console as by clicking on
Import
and following the steps
Go to the
Block URLs
section.
Navigate to "Configure My Site" > "Block URLs".
Enter the URL of the asset you want to remove.
Click
Block URLs
and follow the prompts to complete your request.

Later it can be used to put this in the app logs

topic.en-US: How to Start Your Online Store on BigCommerce

previewSnippet.en-US: Sruthi takes us on a deep dive of BigCommerce and how it works as a platform, the potential it has, and a look at how it can work with Contentful

content.value: If you've decided to go for this hosted solution and are looking for a guide on how to use BigCommerce, welcome to our in-depth BigCommerce tutorial!

First things first, what exactly is BigCommerce? BigCommerce is a leading e-commerce platform designed to create and manage online stores without requiring expertise in web development or eCommerce. It handles technical aspects, allowing users to focus on selling products online.
In this session, we will discuss comprehensive instructions on BigCommerce store setup.
Create a BigCommerce account
- You can sign-up and
start your free trial
(15-day trial)
here.
Adding Products
Managing Inventory
Payment Processing
Shipping and Delivery
Managing Orders

previewSnippet.en-US: This session goes over our implementation of GraphQL and how to use it, this is aimed at those who have no experience with GraphQL

content.value: How to GraphQL
In the session we looked at some of the benefits of GraphQL and REST, we compared them and took a look at how to use GraphQL. Primarily we used
this Miro
to collaborate about the topics in the session.

Benefits of GraphQL:
Single endpoint for all requests.
Clients can specify exactly what data they need.
Reduces over-fetching and under-fetching of data.
Query language allows for nested data retrieval in a single request.
Highly flexible as clients define the structure of the response.
More efficient as it reduces the number of requests and the amount of data transferred.
Schema and type system provide strong typing and validation.
Example query:
Most importantly, if you want to learn more about GraphQL - take a look
here!

title.en-US: Ninetailed and Contentful, what do we need to know?

content.value: Firstly, what is Ninetailed?

Ninetailed is a personalisation and A/B testing platform designed to integrate with CMSs and dynamic websites to enable marketers to generate personalised experiences per persona to improve conversion rates and ROI.

Now these are a lot of buzzwords, but what do they really mean? When we think of personalisation we tend to think of things tailored to you as an end user, and that is exactly accurate. Ninetailed analyses data from end users to ensure the right experience is being shown to you based on a set of important factors such as whether or not you're a first-time visitor, you're a loyal customer, your location, and so on.
What do we need to Support and how does it work?
Ninetailed has
integration with Contentful
as well as Contentstack, who?
How do I set it up?
When setting up Ninetailed, you can start by installing the
Ninetailed app
into your Contentful space, doing this will require you to sign up to a Ninetailed account and authorizing the connection between Contentful and Ninetailed.
You can then go ahead and select your connected space, in my case TAM Hub and create that content source.
Once the sync is complete, your content types will be listed and you can personalise all or specific options. In my case I am only interested in the parent entries:
Then you can create audiences and experiences. However, to do this you must have it set up in your
delivery
(front-end). In order for this to be successful, you usually need a data source and fortunately Ninetailed does offer
no-code options
. For this demo, we're using the TAM Hub site which only has our internal traffic. You can use the
Ninetailed Experience API
if your customer source isn't listed.
So let's start to configure some aspects of Ninetailed in our app.
Insights

This automatically sends events when they are wrapped in a Ninetailed SDK Experience component. To get this we need to install it in our project by running: npm install @ninetailed/experience.js-plugin-insights
Note, since we're using Next.js we need to install: import { NinetailedProvider } from "@ninetailed/experience.js-next";

Now our component is wrapped around our entire site. We need to ensure we are sending the events that the SDK wants to track and there are a few ways to do this, Google Tag Manager, SDK or API, or a Customer Data Integration. Start
here
and then go
here
. We'll be using the SDK which we've already installed.

codeSnippet.en-US:
<body className={`${inter.className} h-full`}>
        <NinetailedProvider
          clientId=""
          environment="main"
          plugins={[]}
          componentViewTrackingThreshold={2000}
          requestTimeout={5000}
          locale="en-US"
          // Specify an alternative Experience API base URL
          // url="https://experience.ninetailed.co"
          // Set to to true ONLY if using an unindexed CMS
          // useSDKEvaluation=true
        >
          <>
            {session === null || !session?.user ? null : (
              <Navbar navData={navData} />
            )}
            <main className="max-w-screen-xl m-auto">{children}</main>
            {session === null || !session?.user ? null : <Footer />}
          </>
        </NinetailedProvider>
      </body>

previewSnippet.en-US: This is a short video that covers how aliasing works within Contentful and how you can merge changes into the master/main branch

content.value: More information on this
here

What is an environment alias?

Environment alias is a static ID that allows you to access and modify the data of its selected target environment. The environment alias target can be quickly switched to a different environment.
The first environment alias that is set up in a space, is granted a default ID ‚Äúmaster‚Äù.
